question: The "The 13 Martyrs of Arad" was a mass execution that happened as part of which event?
explanation: The "The 13 Martyrs of Arad" was a mass execution that happened as part of the Hungarian Revolution, 1849. The Thirteen Martyrs of Arad were the thirteen Hungarian rebel generals who were executed by the Austrian Empire on 6 October 1849 in the city of Arad, then part of the Kingdom of Hungary (now in Romania), after the Hungarian Revolution (1848â€“1849). The execution was ordered by the Austrian general Julius Jacob von Haynau.
